    • Method Detail

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove(int startRow,
                           int startCol,
                           int endRow,
                           int endCol,
                           ChessPiece[][] board)
        Rook isValidMove checks if the desired location is reachable by moving in the cardinal directions centered on the rook. Using verticlePos and horizontalPos, the function determines the direction attempting to be moved, then checks all locations in that direction. The function keeps going until reaching the edge of the board, a piece that blocks the rooks path, or the desired location. The function only returns true if the desired location is reached before any obstacles.
        Specified by:
        isValidMove in class ChessPiece
        Parameters:
        startRow - startRow is the row of the piece being tested
        startCol - startCol is the column of the piece being tested
        endRow - endRow is the row of the space attempting to be moved to
        endCol - endCol is the column of the space attempting to be moved to
        board - board is the 8x8 chessboard housing all the pieces. This is passed to check for things such as friendly pieces being in the end location, or enemy pieces being in the path of the move.
        Returns:
        isValidMove returns true if the move is acceptable, or false if it breaks the rules

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        toString override for Rook. Prints a 'w' or 'b' depending on color, followed by a capital 'R'
        Overrides:
        toString in class ChessPiece
